algorithm_technique: Digit DP: Count numbers by length, then by prefix matching N.
problem_summary_simple: Count positive integers <= N using a given set of digits.
problem_summary_technical: Digit DP to count numbers of length less than N's length, then count numbers with same length as N by matching digits from left to right.
key_insights: Break down the problem into counting numbers with fewer digits than N and then numbers with the same number of digits as N.
For numbers with the same number of digits, use a digit-by-digit comparison with N, leveraging the sorted digit set.
The core idea is to count valid prefixes and then multiply by the number of ways to complete the suffix.
